conbody.p: To run an instance of a VM image, you must associate the image with a qualified kernel and ramdisk image. You can view available kernel and ramdisk images using the euca-describe-images command. Kernel images begin with the prefix eki- followed by an eight-character string (for example, eki-6CDC12F6). Ramdisk images begin with the prefix eri- followed by and eight-character string (for example, eri-A98C13E4).
There are three ways to associate a kernel and ramdisk with an instance:

ul.li: You can associate a specific kernel/ramdisk identifier with an image when youbundle the image.
You can specify a qualified kernel and ramdisk along with the image id when you run an instance.
You can have the administrator default pre-registered kernel/ramdisk identifiers to be used if a kernel/ramdisk is unspecified by either of the above options.
